name: Azure Storage Security Benchmark
description: Security benchmark for Azure Storage accounts based on Azure Security Benchmark and best practices

controls.name: Enable Secure Transfer
controls.description: Ensure that Secure transfer required is enabled to enforce HTTPS for all storage account connections.
controls.portal_path: Storage Accounts > [Storage Account Name] > Configuration > Secure transfer required

controls.name: Restrict Public Access
controls.description: Disable public network access for the storage account unless explicitly required, and configure firewall rules.
controls.portal_path: Storage Accounts > [Storage Account Name] > Networking > Firewalls and virtual networks

controls.name: Enable Blob Public Access Control
controls.description: Ensure that Allow Blob public access is disabled to prevent anonymous access to blobs.
controls.portal_path: Storage Accounts > [Storage Account Name] > Configuration > Allow Blob public access

controls.name: Use Customer-Managed Keys for Encryption
controls.description: Configure storage accounts to use customer-managed keys (CMK) for data encryption instead of Microsoft-managed keys.
controls.portal_path: Storage Accounts > [Storage Account Name] > Encryption > Customer-managed keys

controls.name: Enable Soft Delete for Blobs
controls.description: Enable soft delete for blobs to allow recovery of deleted blob data within the retention period.
controls.portal_path: Storage Accounts > [Storage Account Name] > Data protection > Enable soft delete for blobs

controls.name: Configure Minimum TLS Version
controls.description: Set the minimum TLS version to 1.2 for secure communication with the storage account.
controls.portal_path: Storage Accounts > [Storage Account Name] > Configuration > Minimum TLS version

controls.name: Enable Microsoft Defender for Storage
controls.description: Enable Microsoft Defender for Storage to detect and alert on suspicious activities.
controls.portal_path: Storage Accounts > [Storage Account Name] > Security + networking > Microsoft Defender for Cloud

controls.name: Enable Diagnostic Logs
controls.description: Enable diagnostic logging for Storage account operations to monitor and audit activities.
controls.portal_path: Storage Accounts > [Storage Account Name] > Monitoring > Diagnostic settings

controls.name: Use Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
controls.description: Implement least-privilege access using Azure RBAC roles for storage account management and data access.
controls.portal_path: Storage Accounts > [Storage Account Name] > Access Control (IAM)

controls.name: Disable Shared Key Access
controls.description: Disable shared key authorization and use Azure AD authentication for storage account access.
controls.portal_path: Storage Accounts > [Storage Account Name] > Configuration > Allow shared key access
